result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Trott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: With count 2 and to case 15CM929 and to any other sentence. With 62 days credit.
*Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample. Court WAIVED mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) due to defendant's financial and mental instability.

Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 = $125.00 + $25.00 + $100.00) gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  

As to Counts 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Corrections with 62 days credit CONCURRENT to count 2 and to case 15CM929 and to any other sentence. 

As to Counts 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Corrections with 62 days credit CONCURRENT to count 1 and to case 15CM929 and to any other sentence. 

Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample.
*   Court WAIVED mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) 
       due to defendant's financial and mental instability.
20 day appeal rights given

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Joseph D Trott not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. 

**Defendant ordered to pay an additional $500.00 cash above any bail that remains on deposit**
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart at 6300 W Brown Deer Road, Brown Deer, WI
